Trial_Design.evidence: A multicenter, cooperative group, single-arm phase II trial (ACOSOG Z5041)

Participants.evidence: Patients with biopsy-confirmed PDAC in the pancreatic head without major mesenteric vessel involvement were eligible.

Intervention.evidence: Participants received an eight-week cycle of G+E before and after surgery.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated the feasibility of perioperative gemcitabine plus erlotinib (G+E) for resectable pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was two-year overall survival (OS).

Number_Randomised.evidence: One hundred fourteen patients were eligible, consented, and initiated protocol treatment.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The two-year OS rate for the entire cohort was 40% (95% CI 31–50) with a median OS of 21.3 months (95% CI 17.2–25.9).

Harms.evidence: Grade 3+ toxicity was reported in 60% during the neoadjuvant phase and 79% overall.
